title: Martial arts
data:
**Martial arts** is a [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that is used when attacking or [kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") enemies while not [wielding](/wiki/Wield "Wield") anything. The base damage for a martial arts attack is 1d4. Naturally, martial arts preserve the [weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").

[Monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") possess this skill, while all other roles use the [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands") skill. When attacking using martial arts without [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") or a [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield"), there is a chance of dealing a [staggering blow](/wiki/Staggering_blow "Staggering blow"), knocking the enemy backwards.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Martial arts skill

| Martial arts |                                      |
| ------------ | ------------------------------------ |
| Max          | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")            |
| Master       | - [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") |
| Grand Master | * [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk")          |

## To-hit and damage

Attacking with martial arts deals [silver damage](/wiki/Silver_damage "Silver damage") if you are wearing a silver ring and no [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves"), similar to any wielded silver object. Blessed gloves or [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") (when kicking) cause +1d4 blessed damage against the [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"), and shapeshifted [vampires](/wiki/Vampires "Vampires").

An attack's skill-based damage bonus only applies if the attack rolls at least a 2 on its primary damage die[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) - the average damage for a d4 attack is not 2.5 + *bonus*, but 2.5 + (0.75 \* *bonus*), making the +9 bonus for Grand Master skill less powerful than it might seem.

In addition to the bonuses below, a Monk not wearing body armor or a shield gets an additional to-hit bonus of (*XL* / 3) + 2.

|              | +to hit | +damage | average damage |
| ------------ | ------- | ------- | -------------- |
| Basic        | +3      | +3      | 4.75           |
| Skilled      | +4      | +4      | 5.5            |
| Expert       | +5      | +6      | 7              |
| Master       | +6      | +7      | 7.75           |
| Grand Master | +7      | +9      | 9.25           |

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit 60c19568](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/60c1956850179f4860e59957138154ec65255998), martial arts is buffed significantly: The martial arts damage bonus is now applied to all hits, though hits that roll a 1 on their d4 will still not train skill. Bare-handed and martial arts combat also has a 1⁄5 chance per skill level above Basic to make an "off-hand" attack, as in [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat") - per [commit fcf1a42c](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/fcf1a42cacece384ad10577cf75240c8c23aacfe), the character must not be wearing a shield. The updated damage numbers (assuming both attacks hit) are:

|              | +to hit | +damage | average damage |
| ------------ | ------- | ------- | -------------- |
| Basic        | +3      | +3      | 5.5            |
| Skilled      | +4      | +4      | 7.8            |
| Expert       | +5      | +6      | 11.9           |
| Master       | +6      | +7      | 15.2           |
| Grand Master | +7      | +9      | 20.7           |

## Strategy

Martial arts is a more than suitable form of primary offense in the early game, but on its own will inevitably fall behind other weapon skills in the late game due to the low base damage, lack of enchantment bonuses, and 1⁄4 chance of skill-based damage bonuses not applying. As a result, Monk characters often forgo martial arts in favor of obtaining an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") with a lower skill point investment, maximizing their [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") to offset the to-hit penalties. While Samurai start with solid weaponry, martial arts gives them enough extra damage that the skill can be used as a fallback against [acid blobs](/wiki/Acid_blob "Acid blob") and other weapon-damaging monsters, and makes the Samurai one of the better choices for weaponless conducts after Monks.

In any scenario, characters relying primarily on martial arts should carry some form of [ranged attack](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") to supplement it against monsters with dangerous passives, which usually overlap with monsters that can damage weapons. Outside of magic, Monks have very few options in terms of ranged weapons, and can only train three relevant skills to Basic: [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") and [shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken"). Samurai are much more limited in terms of magical skill, but have several more ranged weapon skills - they can reach Basic in [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), Skilled in [knives](/wiki/Knives "Knives") and spears, and Expert in [bows](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and shuriken. Rings of [increase damage](/wiki/Ring_of_increase_damage "Ring of increase damage") are incredibly valuable for martial arts practitioners, to the point that it is often worth [eating the rings](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") if possible to accrue large damage bonuses for martial arts and ranged skills alike.

## History

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, including some variants based on these versions, martial arts erroneously receives no skill-based to-hit bonus since the code that grants it is only called if the character is wielding a weapon. This is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Variants

Many variants make some form of adjustment to improve martial arts.

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), advancing skill in martial arts grants a [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [half-dragon](/wiki/Half-dragon "Half-dragon") [Bards](/wiki/Bard "Bard") can reach Expert in martial arts, and [elven](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier_\(starting_race\) "Incantifier (starting race)") and [myrkalfar](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") [Anachrononauts](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") can reach Grand Master.

Any role with the martial arts skill can [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") to attack with both hands, even if wielding only one weapon - Monks can reach Grand Master with two-weapon combat. Any character that is [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") 30 and reaches Grand Master in martial arts can [name](/wiki/Name "Name") the [Grandmaster's Robe](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Grandmaster.27s_Robe "DNetHack artifacts"), an artifact [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") that increases the base dice for martial arts to 1d8 and grants it [exploding dice](/wiki/Exploding_dice "Exploding dice").

The [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") [Buer](/wiki/Buer_\(dNetHack\) "Buer (dNetHack)") grants skill in martial arts and permanently unlocks the skill, while [Eurynome](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Eurynome.2C_the_Lonely_Dancer "Spirits (dNetHack)") increases the size of your unarmed attack's damage dice. Binding Buer allows you to reach Expert in martial arts, while having both Buer and Eurynome bound allows you to reach Grand Master. [The Earth Crystal](/wiki/Crystals_\(dNetHack\) "Crystals (dNetHack)") upgrades the bare-handed combat skill to martial arts and boosts a character's martial arts skill level.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), the enchantment of your gloves is used when calculating damage, and martial arts attacks no longer do only 1 damage 1⁄4 of the time.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a lawful character wearing the [Gauntlets of Purity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_Purity "Gauntlets of Purity") gains a bonus to martial arts damage when fighting unarmed. [Shuriken](/wiki/Shuriken "Shuriken") can be [forged](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)"), which makes them a viable ranged weapon for Monks (they are arguably too rare in vanilla to be considered seriously).

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [Ninja](/wiki/Ninja_\(role\) "Ninja (role)") can reach Master in martial arts.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1174](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L1174)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1111](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L1111)

Martial arts is a skill in NetHack that is used when attacking or kicking enemies while not wielding anything. The base damage for a martial arts attack is 1d4. Naturally, martial arts preserve the weaponless conduct.

Monks and Samurai possess this skill, while all other roles use the bare hands skill. When attacking using martial arts without body armor or a shield, there is a chance of dealing a staggering blow, knocking the enemy backwards.[1]
